skillTree.localised_description: The slightest glance, the merest glimpse from one of the Dark Gods is sufficient to propel their playthings to ever-greater feats of desolation.
This Lord speaks with a dread booming voice - a gift from his Dark Masters to ensure obedience.
When Aarseth proclaims the coming of a great storm, wise men take shelter, for he is never wrong.

skillTree.localised_description: Though eyeless, his gaze burns into the soul, revealing hidden fears and buried guilt.
Beasts do not attack him; they recognize a kinship deeper than speech, yielding to his presence.

skillTree.localised_description: Trees live for thousands of years and have very long memories. When called to fight, centuries of pent-up wrath are unleashed.

skillTree.localised_description: The spellcaster attunes the magic of the wild, channelling its ancient and arcane power.
The Wizard draws wholesome energies from the soil, imbuing companions with the natural resilience of the earth.

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: Swift flashes of an agile form and razor-sharp blades are all this Daemon Lord's victims see of him, but by then it's already far, far too late.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Creatures with tough hides or some kind of natural armour are tough nuts to crack - even a powerful attack may fall foul of their thick-skin.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
The bigger they are, the harder they fall.

skillTree.localised_description: A Chaos Lord dominates – lesser beings cringe from a being that is so intently under scrutiny from the Dark Gods.

skillTree.localised_description: There can be no turning back for those whose souls are turning black.
There is no other choice. There never was.
Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
That which is not offered up to the Dark Gods of the North in tribute is harvested by their servants for their own petty gain.
"You will serve me, wretch, or you will die, there is no other option."
The bleak, brutal landscape of the far north breeds bloody, warlike tribes in thrall to Chaos' delicious, twisted power.
Maybe it is the influence of the Dark Gods that has caused the populace to burgeon and proliferate beyond their natural bounds?
"The time to strike is now!"

skillTree.localised_description: There's something about the harsh, unforgiving nature of northern life that makes its occupants fight harder and longer than many of their soft, southern equivalents.

skillTree.localised_description: Something strange - something no scholar really wishes to discover - governs who dies and who lives in the warlike northern wastes.
War and glory before the Gods are the determining elements in every decision made; there is nothing else worth living - or dying - for.
The tendrils (and tentacles!) of the Northern Gods reach down from the poles and far across the world, twisting and corrupting all they touch.

This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with time spent engaged in melee.

factionEffects.localised_description: Yngve Aarseth is a deranged and powerful seer. He is greatly respected – and feared – throughout Norsca. His eyes were torn out long ago when he was held captive by a malicious band of Goblin raiders, Aarseth claims that his physical blindness allows him to "see all truth". The wizened old seer refuses to serve any of the jarls, even when they threaten him with torture or imprisonment. He knows that the jarls are too frightened of his powers to carry out their threats

effects.description:
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +10
	(all armies)

items.colour_text: A weathered banner, blessed by Urska, the shaman of the Seafarer’s Shrine. Those who offer her a feast or silver are granted visions from the deep—cryptic whispers of coming storms, lost treasures, or unseen dangers lurking beyond the horizon.

A single polished eye-stone, cold to the touch and veined like a glacier, said to have fallen from the skull of the first giant ever slain by man — or so the skalds sing. Yngve Aarseth found it embedded in a troll mound, and since then, no Norscan giant has raised its fist in anger toward him. Instead, they stand straighter when he draws near, their brows furrowed as if in reverence… or confusion. Some whisper that the Eye doesn’t merely remind the giants of the past — it allows them to see through it.
